activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R Vicsik

8:30 AM 22CF49/22CF50 - Defendant James R Vicsik in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for James R Vicsik.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson waives the preliminary hearing on behalf of his client due to receiving an offer. Attorney Harper asks for another date for the arraignment. Court goes over the preliminary hearing form; court binds over.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:25 AM  22CF49/ 22CF50 - Defendant James R Vicsik in court.  Attorney Dominic J. Anderson in court for James R Vicsik.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson asks that the preliminary hearing be scheduled in 22CF50. Attorney Anderson moves to dismiss 22CF49. Court denies the dismissal. Court resets the preliminary hearing in the 22CF49.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

To Those Posting Cash Bond
Payable # 65622

1:14 PM Defendant James Vicsik appears in person. Attorney Anderson appears with JV. 

Recommendation on bail from the State:
$500 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

State asks that the bond condition for no drink to be the same in both unfiled cases.

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attorney Anderson states that his client is able to post $500.

Court Orders:
$100 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

On other bond that was set on 04/20/22 be amended to $1,000 cash bond with no drink that conditions that are listed below and no contact provisions.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Next Appearance set for 04/28/22 10 AM
